intro: Racosperma exile, commonly known as the slender wattle, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces yellow flowers in clusters. Racosperma exile is often found in coastal and inland regions, contributing to local biodiversity.
